definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
housewife (jocularly)/female housekeeper of a higher rank (old)/busybody
housekeeper who looks after old people with no children or whose children do not live with them

sentences.english: A good steward is not wasteful.
sentences.chinese: 因此，好管家是不貪婪的。

sentences.english: In LeiJinYi housekeeper led temporarily first in PengGu lived.
sentences.chinese: 雷錦儀在管家的率領下暫時先在彭家住了下來。

sentences.english: My crystal ball is showing a bull market in live-in gardeners and housekeepers.
sentences.chinese: 我的水晶球顯示住在僱主家的園丁和管家將大受歡迎。

sentences.english: In the Bible, a steward was a servant entrusted to manage an estate.
sentences.chinese: 聖經中，管家是爲主人管理產業的僕人。

sentences.english: At least 1 year working experience in 4-star hotel;
sentences.chinese: 一年以上四星級酒店管家部樓層房務員工作經驗。

sentences.english: He introduced me to his housekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 他把我介紹給他的女管家。

sentences.english: Super-excellent right distinct water ? certificate bluebeard neon gun fragrance cheek ? door family background steward.
sentences.chinese: 水嶋宏扮演的是管家名門出身的超優秀的管家。

sentences.english: Super-excellent right distinct water ? certificate bluebeard neon gun fragrance cheek ? door family background steward.
sentences.chinese: 水嶋宏扮演的是管家名門出身的超優秀的管家。

sentences.english: The masseuse was let in by a housekeeper, who then knocked on the door of Ledger's bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 按摩師由一位女管家領着，來到萊傑臥室的門外敲門。

sentences.english: Three people came to the village two peddle, a HeWen nose ring out what.
sentences.chinese: 三人來到二賢莊叫賣，一個老管家出來喝問何事。

sentences.english: Then the servant took ten camels and made his way to the town of Nahor.
sentences.chinese: 管家把駱駝安置在城外的井旁休息。

sentences.english: All my correspondence is handled by my housekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 我的所有通信都由我的管家操作。

sentences.english: Yet, though remorse, youth's white-faced seneschal.
sentences.chinese: 然而，即使懊悔，青春那蒼白的管家。

sentences.english: Reports to Executive Housekeeper any irregularities observed on the partof the guests.
sentences.chinese: 向行政管家彙報任何在顧客部分的異常情況。

sentences.english: The butler always laid the table.
sentences.chinese: 每次都是男管家把餐具擺好。

definition: son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
young lady of the house/wife of the young master
eldest daughter of an affluent family/(polite) your daughter/bossy or indulged young woman/Miss High and Mighty
